33#include <sys/cdefs.h>
34__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: radeon_sync.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:36 riastradh Exp $");
35
36#include <drm/drmP.h>
37#include "radeon.h"
38#include "radeon_trace.h"
39
40/**
41 * radeon_sync_create - zero init sync object
42 *
43 * @sync: sync object to initialize
44 *
45 * Just clear the sync object for now.
46 */
47void radeon_sync_create(struct radeon_sync *sync)
48{
49 unsigned i;
50
51 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_SYNCS; ++i)
52 sync->semaphores[i] = NULL;
53
54 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_RINGS; ++i)
55 sync->sync_to[i] = NULL;
56
57 sync->last_vm_update = NULL;
58}
59
60/**
61 * radeon_sync_fence - use the semaphore to sync to a fence
62 *
63 * @sync: sync object to add fence to
64 * @fence: fence to sync to
65 *
66 * Sync to the fence using the semaphore objects
67 */
68void radeon_sync_fence(struct radeon_sync *sync,
69 struct radeon_fence *fence)
70{
71 struct radeon_fence *other;
72
73 if (!fence)
74 return;
75
76 other = sync->sync_to[fence->ring];
77 sync->sync_to[fence->ring] = radeon_fence_later(fence, other);
78
79 if (fence->is_vm_update) {
80 other = sync->last_vm_update;
81 sync->last_vm_update = radeon_fence_later(fence, other);
82 }
83}
84
85/**
86 * radeon_sync_resv - use the semaphores to sync to a reservation object
87 *
88 * @sync: sync object to add fences from reservation object to
89 * @resv: reservation object with embedded fence
90 * @shared: true if we should only sync to the exclusive fence
91 *
92 * Sync to the fence using the semaphore objects
93 */
94int radeon_sync_resv(struct radeon_device *rdev,
95 struct radeon_sync *sync,
96 struct reservation_object *resv,
97 bool shared)
98{
99 struct reservation_object_list *flist;
100 struct fence *f;
101 struct radeon_fence *fence;
102 unsigned i;
103 int r = 0;
104
105 /* always sync to the exclusive fence */
106 f = reservation_object_get_excl(resv);
107 fence = f ? to_radeon_fence(f) : NULL;
108 if (fence && fence->rdev == rdev)
109 radeon_sync_fence(sync, fence);
110 else if (f)
111 r = fence_wait(f, true);
112
113 flist = reservation_object_get_list(resv);
114 if (shared || !flist || r)
115 return r;
116
117 for (i = 0; i < flist->shared_count; ++i) {
118 f = rcu_dereference_protected(flist->shared[i],
119 reservation_object_held(resv));
120 fence = to_radeon_fence(f);
121 if (fence && fence->rdev == rdev)
122 radeon_sync_fence(sync, fence);
123 else
124 r = fence_wait(f, true);
125
126 if (r)
127 break;
128 }
129 return r;
130}
131
132/**
133 * radeon_sync_rings - sync ring to all registered fences
134 *
135 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
136 * @sync: sync object to use
137 * @ring: ring that needs sync
138 *
139 * Ensure that all registered fences are signaled before letting
140 * the ring continue. The caller must hold the ring lock.
141 */
142int radeon_sync_rings(struct radeon_device *rdev,
143 struct radeon_sync *sync,
144 int ring)
145{
146 unsigned count = 0;
147 int i, r;
148
149 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_RINGS; ++i) {
150 struct radeon_fence *fence = sync->sync_to[i];
151 struct radeon_semaphore *semaphore;
152
153 /* check if we really need to sync */
154 if (!radeon_fence_need_sync(fence, ring))
155 continue;
156
157 /* prevent GPU deadlocks */
158 if (!rdev->ring[i].ready) {
159 dev_err(rdev->dev, "Syncing to a disabled ring!");
160 return -EINVAL;
161 }
162
163 if (count >= RADEON_NUM_SYNCS) {
164 /* not enough room, wait manually */
165 r = radeon_fence_wait(fence, false);
166 if (r)
167 return r;
168 continue;
169 }
170 r = radeon_semaphore_create(rdev, &semaphore);
171 if (r)
172 return r;
173
174 sync->semaphores[count++] = semaphore;
175
176 /* allocate enough space for sync command */
177 r = radeon_ring_alloc(rdev, &rdev->ring[i], 16);
178 if (r)
179 return r;
180
181 /* emit the signal semaphore */
182 if (!radeon_semaphore_emit_signal(rdev, i, semaphore)) {
183 /* signaling wasn't successful wait manually */
184 radeon_ring_undo(&rdev->ring[i]);
185 r = radeon_fence_wait(fence, false);
186 if (r)
187 return r;
188 continue;
189 }
190
191 /* we assume caller has already allocated space on waiters ring */
192 if (!radeon_semaphore_emit_wait(rdev, ring, semaphore)) {
193 /* waiting wasn't successful wait manually */
194 radeon_ring_undo(&rdev->ring[i]);
195 r = radeon_fence_wait(fence, false);
196 if (r)
197 return r;
198 continue;
199 }
200
201 radeon_ring_commit(rdev, &rdev->ring[i], false);
202 radeon_fence_note_sync(fence, ring);
203 }
204
205 return 0;
206}
207
208/**
209 * radeon_sync_free - free the sync object
210 *
211 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
212 * @sync: sync object to use
213 * @fence: fence to use for the free
214 *
215 * Free the sync object by freeing all semaphores in it.
216 */
217void radeon_sync_free(struct radeon_device *rdev,
218 struct radeon_sync *sync,
219 struct radeon_fence *fence)
220{
221 unsigned i;
222
223 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_SYNCS; ++i)
224 radeon_semaphore_free(rdev, &sync->semaphores[i], fence);
225}
